intro: Cussonia gerrardii, commonly known as the African arrowroot, is a tropical shrub native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and large, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red, berry-like fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests and riverine thickets. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticulture.
